        Check the consistency of the underlying physical database.
        Specified by:
        checkDatabaseConsistency in interface ISystemToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        returnAllResults - true - DBConsistencyCheckResult is returned for every check false - DBConsistencyCheckResults returned only for failures.
        Returns:
        DBConsistencyCheckResult[] Describes results of consistency checks (All checks if returnAllResults=true, otherwise all failures.)

      • checkPartialDatabaseConsistency

        public DBConsistencyCheckResult[] checkPartialDatabaseConsistency(boolean returnAllResults,
                                                         java.lang.String[] tablesToCheck,
                                                         java.lang.String[] consistencyCheckTypesToCheck)
                                                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                                                  ServerStateException,
                                                                  PermissionException,
                                                                  SOAPException,
                                                                  BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: ISystemToolsAPI
        Run a subset of the consistency checks on the underlying physical database.
        Specified by:
        checkPartialDatabaseConsistency in interface ISystemToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        returnAllResults - true - DBConsistencyCheckResult is returned for every check false - DBConsistencyCheckResults returned only for failures.
        tablesToCheck - null - check all tables, else array of tables names to check
        consistencyCheckTypesToCheck - null - check all types, else array of types to check Must be valid ConsistencyCheckTypes.
        Returns:
        DBConsistencyCheckResult[] Describes results of consistency checks
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.

        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • setRunlevel

        public void setRunlevel(SystemRunlevel runLevel)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        ServerStateException,
                        PermissionException,
                        BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: ISystemToolsAPI
        Sets the run level of the server. If the server is currently undergoing a runlevel change, this method will block until that level change has completed.

        The valid run levels that the server can be set to through this method are SystemRunlevel.GW_DB_MAINTENANCE, SystemRunlevel.GW_MAINTENANCE, and SystemRunlevel.GW_MULTIUSER. See the definitions of those constants for more information.

        Specified by:
        setRunlevel in interface ISystemToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        runLevel - The level at which the server should run.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        PermissionException - Thrown when the authenticated SOAP user does not have permission to perform the requested operation
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • submitUpdateStats

        public void submitUpdateStats(java.lang.String description,
                     boolean incremental)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              ServerStateException,
                              PermissionException,
                              SOAPException,
                              BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: ISystemToolsAPI
        Run the update stats process on the underlying physical database. Please use isUpdateStatsRunning() to check on the state of the run.
        Specified by:
        submitUpdateStats in interface ISystemToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        description - null - Description of the job
        incremental - true: the process should perform an incremental update; false: the process should perform a full upgrade
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        PermissionException - Thrown when the authenticated SOAP user does not have permission to perform the requested operation
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

                               RequiredFieldException,
                               SOAPServerException,
                               PermissionException,
                               BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: ISystemToolsAPI
        Dynamically updates the logging level of the given logger.
        Specified by:
        updateLoggingLevel in interface ISystemToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        logger - The name of the logger to be updated - this should be a qualified class or package
        level - One of 5 possible logging levels: INFO, DEBUG, WARN, ERROR, TRACE
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.

        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        SOAPServerException
        PermissionException - Thrown when the authenticated SOAP user does not have permission to perform the requested operation
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs
